Scanned with OKEN Scanner With the intention of taking the said love and affection as a reward and without expecting any reward from you, I present to you the following schedule, the land acquired by me as an ancestral property by my father, Door No. 6-186, Assessment No. 6, as a darshila. 992, which is the R.C. Dhapa and which I have been enjoying with my full possession and rights till today, along with the land worth Rs. 10,93,000/-, this settlement deed is written in your name and given to you free of charge. The said property is taken into your possession on this day itself. Furthermore, from now on, you are the full rightful owner of the said property and you shall pay all the taxes due to the said property to the Shri Panchayat and you, your son and grandson, shall enjoy it freely and happily forever, with all the rights and freedoms, as long as you and your children and grandchildren continue to live in peace and prosperity. Whatever disputes or obstacles may arise from any source whatsoever, I will resolve them all with my own money and I, your heirs and I and my heirs will be able to continue to implement this settlement document without interruption. I hereby declare that I have full and undisputed title to this property and that I have not made any written or verbal transfer of the property to anyone else in violation of this deed, that the boundaries, survey number, boundaries, etc., as stated in this deed, are correct, that there are no other partners or claimants to this property except me, that there are no court transactions of any kind, that I have full rights over the said property and that I have no bank debts of any kind, and that I have given you this settlement deed in good faith in order to make you believe and trust me. The said property is hereby registered in your name in the accounts of the Gram Panchayat. Notice has been filed. This property
Does not fall within the scope of Andhra Pradesh Assigned Lands Act No. 9/1977. This property is not Government property,
This property does not fall within the scope of land ceiling. This property is not a Bhudan property.
Declaration: I hereby declare that the property transferred by this deed does not include any plantations of mango, coconut, betel, sweet potato, etc., precious minerals, mines, quarries of precious stones such as granite, missionary, fish ponds, etc., and I hereby agree to be prosecuted and liable to pay the appropriate tax if any such material fact is found to have been concealed in this deed in the future. Idora Karagi Ee

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 158 of 2026, dated 28/Jan/2026, executed by Muskodi Dwaraka Rani, in favour of her Husband, Muskodi Krishna Prasad, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 156.39 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 6-186, Assessment No. 992, comprised in survey number 180-1, LP No. 950, situated in Billakurru Village and Gramapanchayat, within the District of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Konassema, registered at sub-registrar office B.Kothakota is bounded as follows: North by: 40.10 Ft. Panchayati Road South by: 40.10 Ft. Property of Eethakota Erramsetti East by: 35.10 Ft. RCC Building of Akumarthi Venkateswara Rao West by: 35.10 Ft. Panchayati Road
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible
